content: between your two needles and then up and over your repeat these two rounds 10 10 11 times 60 64 72 right hand needle total stitches ryo reverse yarn over bring yarn to front by bringing it up and over your right hand needle and then foot between your two needles ending at the back of your knit in stockinette stitch knit all stitches until foot work measures 2 shorter than desired measurement from tip of toe to end of heel working short row wrap and turn a knit stitch with yarn in back slip next stitch purlwise to right hand needle bring yarn to front return slipped stitch to left hand needle bring yarn to back then turn work wrap and turn a purl stitch with yarn in front slip next stitch purlwise to right hand needle bring yarn to back return stitch to left hand needle bring yarn back to front then turn work hiding wrap on a knit stitch with right hand needle pick up the wrap from the front and knit it together with the stitch it wraps hiding wrap on a purl stitch with right hand needle pick up wrap through the back of loop and purl it together with the stitch it wraps notes i have written these instructions for magic loop because that is how i like to work my toe up socks i find it less finicky when working the toe and heel if you prefer dpns by all means i have included instructions for both a short row heel and an afterthought heel because i use both regularly depending on the project i ll use an afterthought heel for self striping sock yarn so as not to disturb the stripe sequence of the yarn i ll also use it if i m about a short row heel - socks knit from a one of a kind sock blank we at a point where i should start thinking about a heel dyed but don t feel like thinking so i can just carry on and add the heel in at the end i ll use a short row heel when i m knitting a sock in a solid or gradient dyed yarn or really any time i m not using self striping yarn as i do think it s the neater looking of the two © tanis fiber arts 2019 all rights reserved pattern for personal use only www tanisfiberarts com trusty toe up socks p 3 tan i s heel i use 2 different types of heels depending on the afterthought heel desired finished sock see notes on p 2 either heel is an afterthought heel is worked at the very end of the worked on half the total number of stitches sock knitting process you essentially knit a tube and by tanis lavallée then put the heel in later it can be done with or short row heel without the use of waste yarn but i prefer to use waste
